summary: A character reference letter written by Emily Waitt to Judge Alison J. Nathan on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell, who is facing criminal charges. The letter describes Maxwell's positive personal qualities and role in the author's childhood, and requests the court grant Maxwell bail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the character reference letter. The author describes her as a strong, caring woman who was in a relationship with the author's father and played a positive role in her childhood.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The recipient of the letter, presiding over the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Emily Waitt
persons.context: The author of the letter, who states she knew Ghislaine Maxwell from childhood as Maxwell dated and lived with her father. She writes to offer a positive personal perspective on Maxwell and support her bail request.

connections.description: Emily Waitt states she grew up knowing and looking up to Maxwell, who dated and lived with her father from when she was 10 to 17 years old. They continue to be in touch.
Maxwell is described as having a positive, familial role in Emily Waitt's childhood, driving her to school, organizing games on vacations, and teaching her about generosity and resilience.

events.title: Character Reference Letter Submission
events.description: Emily Waitt submits a character reference letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell, requesting bail.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Emily Waitt, the author, states Ghislaine Maxwell dated and lived with her father from when she was 10 to 17 years old.
The letter is a personal character reference intended to portray Ghislaine Maxwell in a positive light, separate from her criminal charges.
The author explicitly states she is not writing to discuss the charges or argue guilt/innocence, but to offer a 'well-rounded picture' of Maxwell.
The letter's primary purpose is to request that Judge Nathan grant bail to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document is part of the court record for the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
